title: Learning the Influence Graph of a Markov Process that Randomly Resets to Past
summary: This paper addresses the challenge of learning the influence graph of a high-dimensional Markov process, particularly when the system probabilistically 'jumps back in time'. It explores a more general regime of Markov processes with memory.
usefulness_reason: The paper explicitly discusses 'Markov process', which is a fundamental concept in 'Point Process'. The notion of 'jumps back in time' introduces a temporal aspect, and 'influence graph' can imply a spatial or relational structure, making it relevant to 'Spatio Temporal' concepts.
